benchmark_details.name: CableInspect-AD (An Expert-Annotated Anomaly Detection Dataset)
benchmark_details.overview: CableInspect-AD is a high-quality, publicly available dataset created and annotated by domain experts for visual anomaly detection in power line cables, featuring 4,798 high-resolution images with 6,023 annotated anomalies across three types of cables.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To enable research on industrial anomaly detection for robotic power line cable inspection.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The dataset may not encompass every possible anomaly found on a cable in real-world settings due to inherent complexity.

data.source: Images acquired from powered line cables with a focus on identifying various types of anomalies.
data.annotation: Annotations are provided at the image level with bounding boxes, types, and grades for anomalies.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on model predictions during cross-validation.
methodology.interpretation: Higher F1 Score indicates better model performance in detecting anomalies.
methodology.validation: Evaluation is conducted using k-fold cross-validation strategy.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: The dataset includes various grades of anomaly severities.
targeted_risks.harm: Deployment of underperforming models may miss critical anomalies, compromising safety.
